ygData.subject: Re: A great song
ygData.msgSnippet: Tone deaf? Sorry could not help my self. - SnowLynx - Gentlemen Bard of Freeport...
ygData.messageBody:
Tone deaf?

Sorry could not help my self.

- SnowLynx - Gentlemen Bard of Freeport...

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Derek Jones [mailto:algorithm@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, April 21, 1999 5:05 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: [eqbards] A great song
>
>
> From: Derek Jones <algorithm@...>
>
> The other day while coming across a particular warrior on a
> venture, I noticed how he would start fighting something that he
> couldn't handle and constantly rely on others to finish off his
> beasty or zone (zoned more often than not.) I thought a song
> might bring the young warrior some courage, but he didn't seem to
> appreciate my tune? Has any other bard had this problem? The
> lyrics are below--perhaps a fellow bard can advise me on possible
> alterations?
>
> Brave Sir Robin,
> Bravely ran away!
> When danger reared its ugly head
> He bravely tucked his tail and fled!
> Bravely bravely bravely
> Brave Sir Robin
> Bravely ran away
> Brave Sir Robin
> Never becomes afraid
> To have his liver cut out
> and his head bashed in
> and his heart ripped out
> and his eyes pushed in
> and his arms torn off
> and his bowels removed
> and his toes cut off
> and his ribs crushed in
> Bravely bravely bravely
> Brrrave Sir Robin
>
> Why didn't he enjoy my melody?
>
> ~<{SfD}>~
> Nafai - Guildmaster Speakers for the Dead - Veeshan Server
>
> btw-in case anyone is too young, or just didn't know--this
> message was just for fun (as if everyone didn't catch the
> reference on the first line!!)
>
>
>
>
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------

> gardening, gourmet, kitchen, more! Free Shipping in the US!

>
